alert.note: Alert for Los Angeles County Mountains (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 27 at 1:45PM PST until March 01 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM PST TUESDAY... ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM TUESDAY TO 10 PM PST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Moderate snow through Tuesday afternoon, becoming heavy at times late Tuesday afternoon through Wednesday. Snow total of 8 to 16 inches with local amounts to 24 inches, highest in the eastern San Gabriel mountains. Winds will gust from 40 mph to locally 60 mph at times. * WHERE...Los Angeles County Mountains. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, from 1 PM Tuesday to 10 PM PST Wednesday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 1 PM PST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible due to reduced visibility due to snow and blowing snow. Mountain roads, including higher portions of Interstate 5 will likely be impacted at times. Snow drifts, especially above 5000 feet, may be another substantial travel hazard. The weight of recent snow combined with strong winds may down trees and powerlines. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow levels initially between 3000 to 4500 feet may drop as low as 1500 to 2500 feet Wednesday.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions from CalTrans are available by calling 1 800 4 2 7 7 6 2 3.
